bill_title: permit the holders of grazing and agricultural leases on school and public lands to control access to hunt on those lands.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit the holders of grazing and agricultural leases on school and public lands to control access to hunt on those lands. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 5-5-3 be amended to read as follows: 5-5-3. The commissioner of school and public lands shall designate from time to time such lands as may be leased for meadow and pasturage purposes only, also such lands as may be leased for either meadow and pasturage, or for agricultural purposes. The commissioner shall establish such regulations as in his the commissioner's judgment shall be are necessary in order that such lands may be leased most profitably for the state, and upon designation of the lands as herein provided, the commissioner shall proceed to offer the same lands for lease. The holder of the grazing or agricultural lease controls the hunting rights and may grant or deny access to hunt on the leased lands at his or her sole discretion. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
